oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-08-16 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 16, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performer Jean Shepard, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, June Carter, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 984th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Jordanaires; Rod Brasfield; Jean Shepard; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- Hey, Mr. Bluebird (Ernest Tubb, Jordanaires) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Jean Shepard -- Secret Of Life (Jean Shepard) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tommy Jackson -- Sally Gooden (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- What A Friend We Have In Jesus (Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Jordanaires -- Oh Lonesome Me (Jordanaires)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; United States.
